title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કહું ભક્ત કાઠિયાવાડ્યના, જિયાં રહ્યા હરિ કરી વાસ; 
આપી સુખ અતિ ઘણાં, પૂરી જનના મનની આશ.
gujarati.context: I worship the Lord of Kāthīyāvāḍa, who resides in my heart; I have obtained immense joy and the satisfaction of fulfilling my soul's longing.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
નિષ્કામી નિર્મળ અતિ, અતિ આંટીવાળાં અંગ<RHYME_206251>; 
તન ધન સુખ ટળે, તોય ન ચળે સતસંગ<RHYME_206251>.
gujarati.context: A person's wealth and happiness are diminished when they indulge in unnecessary talks; only good company can bring joy to one's life.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એવા ભક્ત અનૂપના, લેતાં નામ આવે આનંદ<RHYME_206253>; 
કહું ભક્ત કારિયાણીના, જેને સ્વામી મળ્યા સુખકંદ<RHYME_206253>.
gujarati.context: The devout souls of Anup's type take joy in chanting the divine name; they are the blessed ones who have found their Lord, experiencing happiness and peace.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત માંચો મોટા હરિજન<RHYME_206254>, વાચ કાચ છે નિશ્ચલ મન<RHYME_206254>; 
વેલો વસતો રામ ખાચર<RHYME_206255>, ક્ષત્રી ભોજોભાઈ ઉજાગર<RHYME_206255>.
gujarati.context: A devout person is considered great, regardless of their social status; they are pure in heart and mind.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
માતરો ને વળી માણસુર<RHYME_206256>, ભક્ત વિસો હરિને હજૂર<RHYME_206256>; 
કણબી વિરદાસ કમો કહીએ<RHYME_206257>, રાઘવ દેવો હરજી લહીએ<RHYME_206257>.
gujarati.context: The devotee's heart is filled with love for God and is always in a state of worship, offering all actions to Him. The soul longs to have an audience with the Lord, just like Raghav (Lord Rama) had with Lord Krishna.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કાનો વીરો બોઘો લખમણ<RHYME_206258>, ગોવો જીવો કુંવરો પંચાણ<RHYME_206258>; 
લાલો ભગવાન ભક્ત સુતાર<RHYME_206259>, લાધો સઇ જેરામ લુવાર<RHYME_206259>.
gujarati.context: The brave and strong-minded ones should live for themselves, not worry about others' opinions. One should surrender to God with a devoted heart, leaving all worldly concerns behind.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ઠકર રતનો રઘો ભગત<RHYME_206260>, હીરો દલવાડી સુમારજત<RHYME_206260>; 
ખોડો ગોવો ધનો માધો શામ<RHYME_206261>, ભવાન પીતાંબર છે નામ<RHYME_206261>.
gujarati.context: The devotee's wealth is his faith, and his treasure is the Lord's remembrance. His name is Bhavan Pitaamber, a symbol of devotion.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહાદિ કહીએ કણબી સુજાણ<RHYME_206262>, ભક્ત રાઠોડ તેજો પરમાણ<RHYME_206262>; 
ધનબા હરિબા શીતબાઈ, મોટા ભક્ત કારિયાણી માંઇ.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a devotee's soul ascending to the divine realm, free from worldly attachments and fully immersed in spiritual pursuit. It highlights the great devotion of a true worshiper who has transcended earthly desires and achieved union with the ultimate reality.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
વિપ્ર જીવો વૈશ્ય વેલોભાઈ<RHYME_206263>, દ્વિજ વાલુ ક્ષત્રી ફઈબાઈ<RHYME_206263>; 
એહાદિ જન ઝમરાળે ગામ<RHYME_206261>, લાઠીદડે ખાચર દાદો નામ<RHYME_206261>.
gujarati.context: A priest should be humble and a warrior should be proud, as one's reputation is built on their actions in life and after death. A person's fame is like the crops they harvest, withering away without proper care and attention.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત કહીએ કાંધોભાઈ<RHYME_206264>, લાઠીદડે વૈશ્ય શામબાઈ<RHYME_206264>; 
રાણો ક્ષત્રી દેવો સતવારો, ચોથો ભક્ત લુણધરે સારો.
gujarati.context: A warrior's devotion is like a strong tree trunk (kandhobhai), while a merchant's is fleeting and uncertain (laathi dadhe). A true devotee is like a fourth god, unshakeable and pure in their faith.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
નસિતપુરે માંચો ખાચર<RHYME_206255>, માવો કુંભાર રહે રામપર<RHYME_206255>; 
ક્ષત્રી પુંજો પાણવી ગામ<RHYME_206261>, ક્ષત્રી કૃષ્ણ ઠકર વશરામ<RHYME_206261>.
gujarati.context: In Nasitpur, a village of chaos and noise, the king (maavo) remains calm like Lord Rama in Ramapar. The warrior's pride is washed away by the pangs of love for his village and his beloved Krishna.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ગલાલબા દયારામ<RHYME_206261>, બેન ભાઈ એ પાટણ ગામ<RHYME_206261>; 
શા આણંદ દ્વિજ લખિરામ<RHYME_206261>, રહે ભક્ત રોઇસાળે ગામ.
gujarati.context: In the town of Patan, a twice-blessed person like Dyaram brings joy; a devout soul like Roisal can reside in this same town.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
સામયો લખમીચંદ જોડો, ખમિદાણામાં પટેલ ખોડો; 
વિપ્ર વાઘજી વીરો વણિક<RHYME_206267>, વશરામ લુવાણો છે એક<RHYME_206267>.
gujarati.context: Samos and Lakhamichand are united as one, just like the Patel community is strong in Khmiadana; all virtuous warriors, merchants, and rulers have a single heart.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
સઇ દેવજી નરસઇ નામ<RHYME_206261>, એહાદિ જન બરવાળે ગામ<RHYME_206261>; 
મામૈયો હાથિયો રામ જન<RHYME_206268>, પટગર અમરો પાવન<RHYME_206268>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotee's name is Sai Devjibhai Narsai, who has settled down in this village; with Mamo and Hathio as his brothers, he is considered fortunate and blessed by God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
રાઇબાઈ લાડુ વલુબાઈ, કાઠી સોમલો કુંડળ માંઇ; 
ખાંભડે પુંજો દેસો રાવળ<RHYME_206269>, ગુંદે વણિક કમો અમળ<RHYME_206269>.
gujarati.context: The summary is: The phrase "Rai Bai Lado Valubai" refers to a beautiful and precious thing, which is so valuable that even a small portion of it would be enough to fill the ocean; It's so valuable that even selling a tiny part of it would make one rich.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જીવો ખાચર ભક્ત અમલ<RHYME_206270>, માતરો ને રાઠોડ ધાધલ<RHYME_206270>; 
સઇ ભગો ગોપાલ સુતાર<RHYME_206259>, ગર લીલાધર પુંજો કુંભાર<RHYME_206259>.
gujarati.context: Live like a wild horse and a devoted servant, don't waste your time in petty quarrels; rely on God Gopal for everything.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કાઠી ઉકો દલો હરિદાસ<RHYME_206271>, ભગો લુવાર પ્રભુને પાસ<RHYME_206271>; 
મોટાં ભક્ત એક મલુબાઈ, કહીએ કાઠી સારંગપુર માંઇ.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

One who has devotion as strong as the river Ganges, can reach God's doorstep; such great devotees are found in Kathisarangpur.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
સરેવૈયે જીવણો ધાધલ<RHYME_206270>, પાટીએ મોનો કણબી અવલ<RHYME_206270>; 
ભગો ડુંગર ભક્ત વણિક<RHYME_206267>, ક્ષત્રી બાવોજી ભક્ત છે એક<RHYME_206267>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the devotion of a businessman (vani) and a warrior (kshatriya) who, despite their different professions, have one thing in common: their love for God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
રામ જોગિયો જન સુજાણ<RHYME_206262>, આવ્યા પ્રભુ તેડ્યે તજ્યા પ્રાણ<RHYME_206262>; 
જેઠ સુર અલૈયો ખાચર<RHYME_206255>, લાખો ભક્ત એ ઝીંઝાવદર<RHYME_206255>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

Ram has taken his devotees to a place where God resides, and countless devotees have been blessed with eternal life at Zinjavadar.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
વીરા બે વેલો કલો સુતાર<RHYME_206259>, ભક્ત અજો પિપલિયા મોઝાર<RHYME_206259>; 
ભક્ત નિંગાળે કાળો રાવળ<RHYME_206269>, ભજે લાધો હરિ નિરમળ<RHYME_206269>.
gujarati.context: The brave soul is torn between two loves: the world and God. Ultimately, they surrender to God's love, leaving worldly desires behind.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ગોવો હીરો રૂડો લીંબો લહીએ<RHYME_206257>, જેઠો જીવો ભગો અજો કહીએ<RHYME_206257>; 
આંબો રામજી કણબી જન<RHYME_206268>, ભટ ખીમજી રામ પાવન<RHYME_206268>.
gujarati.context:
As the couplet says "Govo Hiro Rudo Limbo Lahe", life is a fleeting moment to be cherished, and one should live it to the fullest.

The poem further emphasizes this idea by saying "Aambo Ramji Kanbi Jan" that only then can we truly enjoy our life.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
રણછોડ લાલો જસો લવાર<RHYME_206272>, ગોવિંદાદિ રહે માંડવધાર<RHYME_206272>; 
વાવડિયે ખાચર ભાયો ઉગો, કેરાલે નાજો પ્રભુ ને પુગો.
gujarati.context: In this Gujarati couplet, the speaker describes the beauty of the Lord's abode, where even the humblest beings are elevated to a high status. The Lord is said to grant salvation to those who worship Him with devotion.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી રૈયો વસતો ડોસાજી, રહે સુખપુર દુઃખ તજી; 
હરિભક્ત વાલજી સુતાર<RHYME_206259>, દેવધરિયે રામજી લુવાર<RHYME_206259>.
gujarati.context: A warrior's home is filled with worry and sorrow, while a devotee's heart is at peace; a soul devoted to God sleeps peacefully, while the Lord takes them away like a lotus leaf on water.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કાઠી નાથો શેઠ ભાઈચંદ<RHYME_206275>, ભજે નાગલપુરે ગોવિંદ<RHYME_206275>; 
ભક્ત બહુ બોટાદે ભાવિક<RHYME_206276>, જાણે સાર અસાર વિવેક<RHYME_206276>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The humble and devout brother-in-law, Govind, worships Lord Gopal at Nagalpur; He knows the true nature of worldly attachments and renunciation.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિભક્ત હમીર ખાચર<RHYME_206255>, સોમલો માતરો ઉજાગર<RHYME_206255>; 
દાસો ગોદડ નાથો ધાધલ<RHYME_206270>, ખોડો ભક્ત હરિનો અવલ<RHYME_206270>.
gujarati.context: The devout devotee's heart is pure and true, like a lamp burning bright; the humble servant's soul is elevated by devotion to God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિભક્ત હાથિયો ને સુથો, જેણે તજ્યો સંસાર સમુથો; 
એહાદિ કહીએ કાઠી ભક્ત<RHYME_206278>, ભજી હરિ થયા મોટા મુક્ત<RHYME_206278>.
gujarati.context: One who is devoted to God and has renounced worldly attachments; through devotion, they have attained great liberation.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
શેઠ અદો ને ભગો ભાવિક<RHYME_206276>, કૃષ્ણ કેશવ જાણો વણિક<RHYME_206276>; 
ભક્ત હીરો મેઘો મૂળચંદ<RHYME_206279>, નાનચંદાદિ વણિક વૃંદ<RHYME_206279>.
gujarati.context: The merchant Sheth and his brother Bhago are known for their business acumen, like Krishna and Keshav. Similarly, the devotees of God are as numerous as clouds and rivers, with many followers in their group.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ અજો જેઠો શિવો મોનો, સોની ધનો ભગત પ્રભુનો; 
ભક્ત લાધો મુલો ભાવસાર<RHYME_206281>, અમરશી કંસારો ઉદાર<RHYME_206281>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the pious devotee who offers his entire being to God, and is considered worthy of receiving divine blessings. The speaker expresses gratitude for such a fortunate state, comparing it to the unshakeable mountain of Amarshila.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
મસ્તિ આદિ ભક્ત બીજા બહુ, સત્સંગી છે સ્વામીના સહુ; 
રહે બોટાદ ગામમાં વાસે, ભૂલ્યે ન બેસે નાસ્તિક પાસે.
gujarati.context: A true devotee is one who can forget the world's allure, and reside at the Lord's feet; a worldly person cannot even sit still in a village, let alone remember God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
શેઠ પીતાંબર રહે અલાઉ<RHYME_206284>, હરિ ભજી લીધો મોટો લાઉ<RHYME_206284>; 
રાજો ભીમો ને વાઘો સુતાર<RHYME_206259>, ખસમાં ભક્ત ભોજો લુવાર<RHYME_206259>.
gujarati.context: A great soul like Sheth Pitambor lives eternally, having fully devoted himself to God's worship. Just as powerful kings and fierce animals are tamed by their natural habitats, a devotee is completely consumed by their love for the divine.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ગામ બગડે જશો ખાચર<RHYME_206255>, બાઈ બગી આદિ ઉજાગર<RHYME_206255>; 
ભક્ત જાળીલે પાંચો કુંભાર<RHYME_206255>, કરી સતસંગ તર્યો સંસાર<RHYME_206255>.
gujarati.context: The village will prosper when there is harmony and unity among its people; a true devotee can bring about peace and prosperity by following the path of goodness.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
સુંદર ભક્ત સુંદરિયાણા માંઇ<RHYME_206285>, ખાચર ડોસો વસતો કેવાઇ<RHYME_206285>; 
શેઠ હેમો વનો હીરો ભક્ત<RHYME_206278>, ભગો ગલો ને મોરાર મુક્ત<RHYME_206278>.
gujarati.context: A beautiful devotee is freed from the cycle of life and death when their love for God becomes as pure as a gemstone, unsoiled by material desires.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કહીએ કપુરાદિ તુલાધાર<RHYME_206286>, ભક્ત એક નાનજી સોનાર<RHYME_206286>; 
ભક્ત ક્ષત્રી દાદોજી સબલો, હરિજન મલો મરુસ્થલો.
gujarati.context: The devotee is like a small pearl, pure and precious, while the kshatriya (warrior) lineage is strong but prone to downfall.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
રામદાસ આદિ જન જેહ<RHYME_206288>, વસે સુંદરિયાણામાં તેહ<RHYME_206288>; 
દેવજાતિ મોડ બનુભાઈ, જેને પ્રભુ વહાલા ઉર માંઇ<RHYME_206285>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Ramdas and others, beautiful souls reside; those who are born in divine lineage, God's love dwells within them.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિભક્ત ગણેશ લુવાર<RHYME_206259>, વસે પોલારપુર મોઝાર<RHYME_206259>; 
દ્વિજ ગગો ક્ષત્રી જીવોભાઈ, હરિજન એ જસકા માંઇ<RHYME_206285>.
gujarati.context: Ganesh, devoted to Lord Hari, settles in Polasar's mozaar; A dvij (twice-born) Gago, a warrior, lives his life with devotion to Lord Jagannath.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ દેવો શેઠ પુંજોભાઈ, એહાદિ જન અણિયાલી માંઇ<RHYME_206285>; 
ભક્ત કણબી ઘેલો છે નામ<RHYME_206261>, વસે જન તે વાવડી ગામ<RHYME_206261>.
gujarati.context: The virtuous are like the gods, but the common man remains lowly; a devotee's name is esteemed, and his people prosper in their village.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કોળી ભક્ત નાજો એક કાવે, ભજે હરિ રહે બુબાવાવે; 
ક્ષત્રી ભીમોભાઈ ભોજોભાઈ, દેશળજી રહે વાગડ માંઇ<RHYME_206285>.
gujarati.context: The devotee's prayer is like a single note on the flute of God, resonating with joy and ecstasy; even kings and warriors can't help but surrender to their Lord's will in times of crisis.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
શા દામો વશરામ કુંભાર<RHYME_206255>, વૈશ્ય રામ મોરશિયા મોઝાર<RHYME_206255>; 
સોની ભક્ત નારાયણજી નામ<RHYME_206261>, ભક્ત કાનજી શા જીવરામ<RHYME_206261>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1 to 2 line summarization:

God has made us rich with the treasure of love, and in this treasure lies our true wealth.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ આદિ રૂડા હરિજન<RHYME_206254>, વસે કંથારિયામાં પાવન<RHYME_206254>; 
રાણપુરે રહે વિપ્ર સંઘજી, કર્યો સતસંગ કુસંગ તજી.
gujarati.context: This Gujarati couplet describes the humble abode of a saintly person, where they reside in simplicity and renounce worldly attachments. In Ranpur, there lives a sage named Sanga Ji, who has abandoned material pursuits for spiritual companionship.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
સંઘો રણછોડ રવો ને રૂપ<RHYME_206290>, પુંજો લખમણ કણબી અનુપ<RHYME_206290>; 
કોળી હરજી ને ઘેલો ભક્ત<RHYME_206278>, હિરાદાસ વૈરાગી વિરક્ત<RHYME_206278>.
gujarati.context: The faithful devotee (bhakt) is like a wild boar, fiercely attached to the Lord's door, and has no desire for worldly desires or wealth. The devotee's heart is pure and yearns only for spiritual connection with God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ નારાયણજી રામબાઈ, ભક્ત એહ આદિ લોયા માંઇ<RHYME_206285>; 
નકિ ભક્ત નાગડકે ગામ<RHYME_206261>, શિરોમણિ ખાચર સુરો નામ<RHYME_206261>.
gujarati.context: Dwiji Naranji Ramabai is a devout devotee who has taken refuge in God; her faith is so strong that even the gods recognize her spiritual prowess.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કાળો માણશિયો નાથોભાઈ<RHYME_206291>, રૂડાં શાંતિબાઈ વલુબાઈ<RHYME_206291>; 
કાઠી ભક્ત ભીમો જેઠો નામ<RHYME_206261>, એહાદિ રહે નાગડકે ગામ<RHYME_206261>.
gujarati.context: As time passes, one's anxiety and worry fade away, and peace settles in like a calm lake. The pious soul, named Bhim, resides in the village of Nagadake with his name etched in its history.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ચોકડિયે સતો રૂડો નાડોદા, જેને શ્રીહરિ સાથે છે મોદા; 
ગામ કોરડે કુંપો ખાચર<RHYME_206255>, હરિભક્ત ભલો ધૂનિધર<RHYME_206255>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the joy and unity of a couple, where their love is like a strong bond between Sri Hari (God) and them. Just as the village coriander plant is tied to its stem, they are deeply connected in their devotion to God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત કણબી શામજી નામ<RHYME_206261>, ભજે હરિ ચોરવિરે ગામ<RHYME_206261>; 
પિપરડીએ ભટ ભાણજી, કરી જીત નારાયણ ભજી.
gujarati.context: The devotee's name is Shamaji, and they praise God with all their might; the Lord, pleased with their devotion, grants them victory in this life.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત ભીમો માલો હાથસણિયે, નાજો ખાચર મોઢુકે ગણિયે; 
શેઠ શામજી વસે વિછિએ<RHYME_206257>, કલો સઇ કડુકામાં કહીએ<RHYME_206257>.
gujarati.context: The pious and brave devotees of God hold nothing dearer than Him, not even their life or breath. The true worshipper of God should be ready to sacrifice everything, including his own self, in the pursuit of spiritual growth.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ગોખલાણામાં જીવો લુવાર<RHYME_206259>, પ્રભુ ભજી થયો ભવપાર<RHYME_206259>; 
ભક્ત મોકો ખાચર માણશિયો, શવો લુવાર ખંભાલે રિયો.
gujarati.context: Live with simplicity and devotion to God, for a virtuous life is truly rewarding. A devotee's ultimate goal is to attain liberation from the cycle of birth and death.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
બાબરામાં દ્વિજ ગંગારામ<RHYME_206261>, ખાચર ઉનડ કરિયાણે ગામ<RHYME_206261>; 
ભક્ત શેઠ જુઠો નિલવલે, ભજે જગપતિ મતિ ન ચળે.
gujarati.context: In the heart of Babra, there is a sacred place where Ganga Ram is worshipped; only a true devotee like Sethji can realize God's presence and remain steadfast.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 115: Kāṭhiyāvāḍ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિજન અરજણ માવજી, આશા અસત ત્રિકમે તજી; 
સારાં હરિજન સોનબાઈ, રાજગર રાયપુર માંઇ<RHYME_206285>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The lowly Harinjans (Dalits) have hope, their threefold sorrow will soon pass; in Saurashtra's Rajkot district, they live with dignity and respect.

gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૫: કાઠિયાવાડ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A devotee like me should live under God's shelter, and enjoy the bliss of His presence. With a peaceful mind, I'll experience divine joy in my soul.

transliteration.couplet:
Niṣhkāmī nirmaḷ ati, ati āṭīvāḷā ang; <RHYME_2>
Tan dhan sukh ṭaḷe, toy na chaḷe satasang.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks of the importance of selfless effort (niṣhkāmī) and how it brings joy (sukh), rather than seeking personal gain or attachment (tan dhan).

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The devotee's soul is satisfied with the nectar of God's name, and they find joy in its remembrance. The devotee's heart is filled with happiness when their Lord brings them comfort.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Māncho moṭā harijan, vāch kāch chhe nishchal man; <RHYME_4>
Velo vasato Rām Khāchar, kṣhatrī Bhojobhāī ujāgar.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: A devotee's heart is unsteady and fickle-minded, but their speech remains firm and unwavering;

transliteration.couplet:
Mātaro ne vaḷī Māṇasur, bhakta Viso Harine hajūr; <RHYME_5>
Kaṇabī Virdās Kamo kahīe, Rāghav Devo Harajī lahīe.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: Visnu's devotee Bhakta Viso meets with Mānusur, a descendant of Manu, at the lotus feet of Lord Hari. The soul then inquires about its past lives and karma, seeking liberation from rebirth through devotion to Raghav Devo (Lord Rama).

transliteration.couplet:
Kāno Vīro Bogho Lakhamaṇ, Govo Jīvo Kuvaro panchāṇ; <RHYME_6>
Lālo Bhagwān bhakta sutār, Lādho sai Jerām luvār.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: The couplet is comparing a devoted devotee to a cowherd's five calves, emphasizing their deep connection with God.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:
Ehādi kahīe kaṇabī sujāṇ, bhakta Rāṭhoḍ Tejo paramāṇ; <RHYME_8>

transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

God is present in every atom and molecule, and devotees are blessed with divine knowledge;

transliteration.couplet:

Ehādi jan Zamarāḷe gām, Lāṭhīdaḍe khāchar Dādo nām.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

A merchant is rich if he has wealth and possessions, while a king is powerful with his authority; similarly, a farmer's prosperity lies in the land and crops he tends. A person's wealth is measured by their occupation and skills, like a carpenter's tools or a farmer's harvest.

transliteration.couplet:

Rāṇo kṣhatrī Devo Satavāro, chotho bhakta Luṇadhare sāro.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: A Kshatriya devotee is said to be a Kandhobhai, while a Vaishya devotee is said to be a Shambai. A king's devotion is like Satavaro, and a commoner's devotion is like Lunadhare.

transliteration.couplet:
Nasitpure Māncho Khāchar, Māvo kumbhār rahe Rāmapar; <RHYME_11>

transliteration.context: The couplet describes two different paths: one of material wealth and the other of spiritual growth.

transliteration.couplet:

Shā Āṇand dvij Lakhirām, rahe bhakta Roisāḷe gām.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two places: Dvij Galalba, a place of kindness and compassion, is similar to Bhānugam; Shā Āṇand, a place of blissful pleasure, is akin to Bhakta Roisale.

transliteration.couplet:
Sāmayo Lakhamīchand Joḍo, Khamidāṇāmā Paṭel Khoḍo; <RHYME_13>
Vipra Vāghajī Vīro vaṇik, Vasharām Luvāṇo chhe ek.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context:
The summary is:

Lakhamīchand's words are tied to the wind, and Khamidā's fate is sealed; Vipra Vāghajī is a brave warrior with a single-minded love for Vasu.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: Lord Sai Devajī is worshipped in the village of Baravāḷe, and the noble Lord Ram's chariot is praised by Māmaiyo. His sacred horse's name is Paṭagar Amaro, which brings salvation.

transliteration.couplet:
Rāibāī Lāḍu Valubāī, kāṭhī Somalo Kunḍaḷ māi; <RHYME_15>
Khābhaḍe Punjo Deso Rāvaḷ, Gunde vaṇik Kamo amaḷ.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: A rich woman named Valubai is compared to a sweet dish called Somalo Kunḍaḷ. The couplet also mentions a merchant named Ravaḷ who lives in a place called Punjo Deso.

transliteration.couplet:

Sai Bhago Gopāl sutār, Gar Līlādhar Punjo kumbhār.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: Life's journey is pure and simple, just like the humblest of servants. The lord's play is akin to a potter shaping clay, creating beautiful forms.

transliteration.couplet:

Moṭā bhakta ek Malubāī, kahīe kāṭhī Sārangpur māi.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: A devotee brings a sweet offering to the Lord Haridasa, and another asks for blessings from the Lord's feet. A simple devotee is like a river Malubai, flowing smoothly without pretenses.

transliteration.couplet:
Sarevaiye Jīvaṇo Dhādhal, Pāṭīe Mono kaṇabī aval; <RHYME_18>
Bhago Ḍungar bhakta vaṇik, kṣhatrī Bāvojī bhakta chhe ek.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet in English:

The true devotee is one who has renounced worldly desires and is free from attachments. The merchant and the king are also devotees, but they are bound by their worldly roles.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: Ram's soul is blessed with devotion, his breath remains in the Lord's abode. Thousands of devotees are attracted to Zinzavadar like a cow to its natural grazing land.

transliteration.couplet:

Bhakta Ningāḷe Kāḷo Rāvaḷ, bhaje Lādho Hari niramaḷ.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The faithful are like merchants who carefully weigh their goods, and the devotees are like those who wholeheartedly worship Lord Krishna with love. The devotees sing sweet melodies to Him, their hearts filled with joy and devotion.

transliteration.couplet:

Āmbo Rāmajī kaṇabī jan, Bhaṭ Khīmajī Rām pāvan.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: A person's wealth is their wisdom and good deeds that they do, while a wealthy person may be rich but not necessarily wise or good.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A person's wealth is in their actions and character, not just material possessions. True richness comes from being mindful of one's behavior and having a pure heart.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: In Sukhapur, the Lord's devotee suffers no pain, while in Dosājī, even the king feels distress.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A devotee (Bhakta) with a humble heart and pure intentions is a true friend of God (Govind), and can distinguish between right and wrong (sār asār vivek).

transliteration.couplet:

Dāso Godaḍ Nātho Dhādhal, Khoḍo bhakta Harino aval.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the devotion of two people: Hamīr Khāchar is a true devotee and his mother Somalo is awakened to devotion.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context:

A devotee of God (Haribhakta) has gained spiritual liberation by uniting with the divine; they now freely enjoy their life's fruits.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The merciful Lord Krishna knows the trader's secrets and forgives his mistakes. The devotee Hīro is like the merchant Megho, seeking spiritual wealth from God.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The devotee's love for God is like a farmer's devotion to the land, yielding abundant results. Through this love, one can attain the divine state of liberation and union with the Supreme Being.

transliteration.couplet:

Rahe Boṭād gāmmā vāse, bhūlye na bese nāstik pāse.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: The devotee is a seed of divine joy and is blessed by the Lord's presence in satsang. Those who don't believe in God will not settle down in this world, no matter where they reside.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context:
The humble devotee remains near the Lord's abode and is consumed by devotion; meanwhile, a king or noble-minded one should serve the Lord with all their might.

A royal personage has tamed the wild elephant of ego, while a true devotee enjoys the Lord's loving company.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: In a village, one finds joy and happiness in the company of friends; similarly, in spiritual gatherings, one's soul finds solace.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A devotee is beautiful when they please their beloved God, and humble when living amidst worldly pleasures. A true devotee's heart is pure and free from attachment, like a lotus flower that remains unaffected by the muddy water it blooms in.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The devotees of God are beautiful and resplendent like the goddesses; they are under the divine control of God's will.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A king's daughter from a low-caste family hopes to marry into royalty, and her beauty is not matched by her social standing. Despite being of lower status, she still dreams of marrying a prince.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A widow from Pipaliya village, Harijan Aju Mūḷībāī, is waiting for her beloved; a devotee of Lord Ram, Dwij Gangev Ṭhakar Rām, has been separated from his love.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The rich and powerful Kshatrī Mūlujī has a lot of money and assets, but the poor and humble one has the love of God as their own work. The poor person finds joy in worshipping God, not seeking wealth or material possessions.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: This couplet describes the devotion of a humble devotee who is bound to the Lord with love and attachment. It praises the great devotees Mānḍavā māi and Vaishya Rāmajī, who were deeply devoted to Lord Krishna.

transliteration.couplet:
Umarāliye Rājo āhīr, harijan man ati dhīr; <RHYME_55>
Kṣhatrī Togo Hako harijan, Shā Kamaḷashī Govaradhan.  <RHYME_55>
transliteration.context: The brave and mighty King Rajo is a true hero among the Harijans, just like Kshatriya Togo Hako and Shri Kamleshwarji from Godhara.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The lord Indra is among the merchants, while one who has the Lord Premo as their own; Bhim, Vasu, and Kavas are in awe of Lord Hari's majesty.

transliteration.couplet:

Dvij ek Devarāmbhāī, jan Āṇadi Lāḍakībāī.  <RHYME_57>
transliteration.context: The seeker of knowledge and devotion worships Lord Narayan, performing duties with dedication. One who is twice-born, born from the divine, and pure in thought and deed.

transliteration.couplet:

Bhakta Chāvaḍā Bhīm Jesang, jene sācho lāgyo satasang.  <RHYME_58>
transliteration.context: A devotee is like a fragrant agarbatti (incense stick), pleasing to God; one who is true in their devotion and gatherings with others becomes blessed.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan Chāraṇ Adobhāī, ehādi bhakta Bhāḍuī māi; <RHYME_59>
Ajo Lakho Kṛuṣhṇa jan Kāko, Jeṭho Malār Shavo bhakta pāko.  <RHYME_59>
transliteration.context: The devotee's love is pure and true, like the gentle breeze of Malār that soothes the soul. Just as the lotus blooms untouched by the mud, a true devotee remains unaffected by worldly desires.

transliteration.couplet:
Vasato Kāno Dudo Nāḍodā, rahe Rāmapure manamodā; <RHYME_60>
Chāraṇ Sāmat Mūlu kāve, koḷī Tejo rahe Chitarāvāve.  <RHYME_60>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the peaceful life of a devotee in Lord Rama's presence, where worries are left behind and peace prevails. It also expresses the longing to be with the divine and being blessed by His presence.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta chhe Govindbhāī, bhaje Hari Sājaḍiyāli māi; <RHYME_61>
Bhakta gar Bhīm Vasharām, rūḍo Rāṇo ne Rāghav nām.  <RHYME_61>
transliteration.context: The devotee is consumed by love for God Govind and worships Hari with all their heart; the devotee's name is Bhima, born in Vashram, with Ravana as his previous birth's name.

transliteration.couplet:

Māt sut laī chālyo sang, Rāṇe rākhyo Goliḍāmā rang.  <RHYME_62>
transliteration.context: A wise friend is hard to find, and an enemy's attack is always unexpected; a mother's love is like a colorful festival, while a treacherous person's charm is fleeting and fake.

transliteration.couplet:

Kuvāḍave kapur vaṇik, bhakta Hīro ne Mevo chhe ek.  <RHYME_63>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a devotee who is deeply immersed in devotion and has achieved spiritual liberation. The second line highlights the devotee's humility, suggesting that their accomplishments are not boastful or self-promoting.

transliteration.couplet:

Kahī kahī thāke kavirāy, athāhano thāh kem thāy.  <RHYME_64>
transliteration.context: A devoted servant is beyond measure, and a poet's inspiration cannot be bound by rules; The poets' words are like sparks that remain even when they're not speaking.

transliteration.couplet:
Agaṇit apār alekhe, te āve kem lakhatā lekhe; <RHYME_65>
Moṭo pratāp Prabhuno joī, kare satasanga sahu koī.  <RHYME_65>
transliteration.context: The infinite and the finite are written together by God's will, while only He knows what is written. Those who seek God's company in spiritual gatherings are blessed by His divine presence.

transliteration.couplet:
Dekhe alaukikpaṇu ati, vaḷī jaṇāya prakaṭ prāpati; <RHYME_66>
Nahi mokṣhapadnī udhār, āve teḍavā antye morār.  <RHYME_66>
transliteration.context: The extraordinary moments are revealed only to those who have achieved self-realization; one does not get salvation without experiencing the final moments of the world.

transliteration.couplet:
Bījā anek parachā thāy, sahu jan jāṇe man māy; <RHYME_67>
Jītyā kām krodh lobh moh, na hoy ek te dekho samoh.  <RHYME_67>
transliteration.context: The couplet highlights the many seeds of desires that exist within us, making it difficult to understand our true selves. Only when we overcome attachment, anger, greed, and ego can we achieve inner peace and balance.

transliteration.couplet:
Evu samajī satsang kare, Swāmī sāmā sāchā pag bhare; <RHYME_68>
Tajī jūṭhā jagatnī āsh, thāy prakaṭ Prabhunā dās.  <RHYME_68>
transliteration.context: In the company of saints, one's soul is filled with truth; In the world's darkness, a seeker finds illumination through devotion to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Teno āve kem gaṇye chhek, lakhiye ek ne rahe anek; <RHYME_69>
Me to manmā karyo vichār, na thāy nāmno niradhār.  <RHYME_69>
transliteration.context: One cannot count the joys of a loving couple, as they remain numerous and endless. I ponder over this thought, free from worldly attachments and names.

transliteration.couplet:
Uttarpanth ākāshno, koī pāmī shake nahi pār; <RHYME_70>
Anḍaj ūḍī ūchā chaḍe, paṇ ambar rahe apār.  <RHYME_70>
transliteration.context: The path of spiritual growth is difficult to tread, as one's ego and desires are hard to overcome; yet, with self-control and discipline, one can ascend to a higher realm.
